Rainald of Dassel was Frederick’s chancellor from 1156 to 1167 and archbishop of Cologne, 1159–67. Thus, like his near contemporaries Thomas Becket in England and William of Tyre in Jerusalem, he combined high ecclesiastical office with a prominent role in government and administration
